sage.camera

Class AbstractCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.AbstractCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICamera
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JOGLCamera

    public class AbstractCamera
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICamera
    AbstractCamera is an abstract base class from which all SAGE camera implementations are derived. It provides protected (subclass-visible) declarations for attributes common to all cameras, including location and U, V, and N camera orientation vectors. Subclasses which implement a camera in a graphics API-specific way (e.g. using OpenGL or DirectX) should use these attributes to maintain their camera's values.

    Additional attributes declared by AbstractCamera include the camera's view volume parameters (field-of-view angle in the Y direction, fovY; aspect ratio, and distances to the near and far clipping planes), and a field holding the IRenderer used by the camera. Subclasses are expected to assign values to these camera attributes.

    Author:
    John Clevenger

      • fovY

        protected double fovY
        The camera's view volume field of view angle in the Y direction (the angle between the bottom and top view volume planes).

      • aspect

        protected double aspect
        The camera's view volume width to height aspect ratio.

      • nearClippingPlane

        protected double nearClippingPlane
        The distance, in world coordinate units, to the camera's near clipping plane. Must be greater than zero.

      • farClippingPlane

        protected double farClippingPlane
        The distance, in world coordinate units, to the camera's far clipping plane. Must be greater than the value of nearClippingPlane.

      • myRenderer

        protected IRenderer myRenderer
        The IRenderer used by this camera.

      • viewportLeft

        protected double viewportLeft
        The left, right, bottom and top boundaries of this camera's viewport on the screen, where all values are fractions (range 0 to 1). The default values are left=bottom=0.0 and right=top=1.0 (in other words, the default viewport covers the entire display screen).

      • viewportRight

        protected double viewportRight
        The left, right, bottom and top boundaries of this camera's viewport on the screen, where all values are fractions (range 0 to 1). The default values are left=bottom=0.0 and right=top=1.0 (in other words, the default viewport covers the entire display screen).

      • viewportBottom

        protected double viewportBottom
        The left, right, bottom and top boundaries of this camera's viewport on the screen, where all values are fractions (range 0 to 1). The default values are left=bottom=0.0 and right=top=1.0 (in other words, the default viewport covers the entire display screen).

      • viewportTop

        protected double viewportTop
        The left, right, bottom and top boundaries of this camera's viewport on the screen, where all values are fractions (range 0 to 1). The default values are left=bottom=0.0 and right=top=1.0 (in other words, the default viewport covers the entire display screen).

      • isOutOfDate

        protected boolean isOutOfDate
        A flag indicating whether the underlying graphics package camera is out of sync with the camera object's representation of the game camera. This flag should be set true when any of the camera's attributes are changed, and cleared to false when the camera's state is applied to the underlying graphics package camera.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractCamera

        public AbstractCamera(IRenderer renderer)
        Constructs an AbstractCamera associated with the specified IRenderer and having a set of default attributes. The defaults are
        • location = Point3D(0,0,0)
        • U = Vector3D(1,0,0)
        • V = Vector3D(0,1,0)
        • N = Vector3D(0,0,-1)
        • View Frustum angle (fovY) = 60 degrees;
        • View Frustum aspect ratio = 1;
        • Near clip plane = 0.01;
        • Far clip plane = 100;
        • Viewport bottom left = (0,0);
        • Viewport top right = (1,1);
        Parameters:
        renderer - - the renderer to which this camera is attached

      • setAxes

        public void setAxes(graphicslib3D.Vector3D right,
                    graphicslib3D.Vector3D up,
                    graphicslib3D.Vector3D viewDir)
        A convenience method for setting all three camera axes via a single call. Note that it is the responsibility of the client to insure that when camera axes are changed that they still form an orthogonal system (that is, that the camera's axes remain mutually perpendicular). The effect of calling this method is the same as making separate calls to setRightAxis(Vector3D), setUpAxis(Vector3D), and setViewDirection(Vector3D).
        Specified by:
        setAxes in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        right - - the new camera "right" (U) axis
        up - - the new camera "up" (V) axis
        viewDir - - the new camera "view direction" (N) axis

      • lookAt

        public void lookAt(graphicslib3D.Point3D target,
                   graphicslib3D.Vector3D worldUp)
        A convenience method for setting the camera axes based on the position of a specified target point. Sets the camera's view direction (N) axis to point from the camera location to the specified target location; uses the specified worldUp vector to determine the direction of the camera's V (up) axis (more formally, sets the camera's V axis to the projection of the worldUp vector onto a plane perpendicular to the camera's N axis); and sets the camera's right (U) axis to a direction perpendicular to the new N and V axes. The direction from the camera to the target must not be identical to the worldUp direction.
        Specified by:
        lookAt in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        target - - the 3D point which the camera should point toward
        worldUp - - the direction of "up" in the world, from which the camera's "up" vector is computed

      • setPerspectiveFrustum

        public void setPerspectiveFrustum(double fovY,
                                  double aspect,
                                  double near,
                                  double far)
        Sets the view volume parameters of this camera to the specified values. Note that calling this method only sets the view volume parameters in the camera object itself, it does not automatically update the underlying camera implementation's view volume.
        Specified by:
        setPerspectiveFrustum in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        fovY - - the vertical (Y) angle of the frustum, in degrees
        aspect - - the aspect ratio (width:height) of the view frustum
        near - - the distance from the camera to the near clipping plane; must be > 0
        far - - the distance from the camera to the far clipping plane; must be > near
        See Also:
        applySettings()

      • getPerspectiveFrustumSettings

        public double[] getPerspectiveFrustumSettings()
        Returns an array of doubles containing the current camera fovY, aspect, nearClippingPlane and farClippingPlane values in that order.
        Specified by:
        getPerspectiveFrustumSettings in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        an array containing the camera perspective frustum settings

      • applySettings

        public void applySettings()
        This method is intended to be overridden by camera implementation subclasses in a way that causes them to update their underlying graphics API camera parameters. The implementation of this method in AbstractCamera is empty and throws a RuntimeException if invoked.
        Specified by:
        applySettings in interface ICamera

      • isOutOfDate

        public boolean isOutOfDate()
        Returns the flag indicating whether this camera's state matches that of the underlying graphics camera managed by a subclass of AbstractCamera. Subclass implementations should maintain the state of this flag so that it matches the current camera state (meaning, whenever the camera object is changed, the flag should be set 'true'; whenever method applySettings() is invoked to update the underlying camera to match the camera object the flag should be reset to 'false').
        Specified by:
        isOutOfDate in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        - true if the underlying graphics system camera is out of date (that is, its settings do NOT match this camera's settings; false if the underlying camera implementation is current

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(BoundingVolume bv)
        This method is intended to be overridden by camera implementation subclasses in a way that returns a boolean indicating whether the specified BoundingVolume intersects the currently-defined camera view volume. The implementation of this method in AbstractCamera is empty and throws a RuntimeException if invoked.
        Specified by:
        intersects in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        bv - The BoundingVolume to compare against the view frustum
        Returns:
        true if the BoundingVolume intersects the view frustum

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(double left,
                        double right,
                        double bottom,
                        double top)
        Sets this camera's viewport boundaries (the region on the screen where the camera view will be displayed) to the specified values. The values represent fractions in the range 0..1 which are percentages of the current display screen width and height respectively.
        Specified by:
        setViewport in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        left - - the left viewport boundary, where 0.0 means the far left side of the display
        right - - the right viewport boundary; 1.0 means the far right side of the display
        bottom - - the bottom viewport boundary; 0.0 means all the way at the bottom of the display
        top - - the top viewport boundary; 1.0 means all the way at the top of the display

      • getViewport

        public double[] getViewport()
        Returns an array containing the current viewport boundaries for this camera on the screen where each array element contains a percentage (range 0 to 1) of screen width/height, with [0]=left, [1]=right, [2]=bottom, and [3]=top.
        Specified by:
        getViewport in interface ICamera

      • getHUD

        public Group getHUD()
        Returns a Group defining the HUD elements for this AbstractCamera.
        Specified by:
        getHUD in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        a Group containing the camera's HUD elements

        public boolean removeFromHUD(SceneNode child)

        Specified by:
        removeFromHUD in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        child - - the element to be removed from the camera's HUD
        Returns:
        - true if the element was found and removed; false otherwise
